area_name: Goliath Rock-AKA the Bob Parrot Boulder

content.description: Start under the arete with jugs and the rock pedestal for feet. Move leftwards up the arete topping out the same for Scary Gene Pool.
content.location: Use the same start as for Pita Chips.

content.description: Sit start the obvious, left-leaning arete with several big, talus blocks under you.

Not better than the original, this is a fun variation of The Seed. Sit start low and make the same first couple moves, but pull in and move back out right around the arete, joining the thin finger crack directly above the starting holds, and top out. Shorter and less gymnastic than it's Siamese twin, but still interesting.
content.location: Start as for the Seed, all the way on the left side as you approach from the main dirt road.

content.description: Stand start with the first two holds in the seam/crack and climb straight up matching on one of the smallest holds at the woods, lockoff, move your feet higher, and then power up to the arete.
content.location: Start with the same two holds as for the problem Off My Meds and climb straight up instead of moving left.

content.description: Stand start on the backside of the boulder at the arete/corner with a tree to your right. Climb up some juggy holds and top out. This is the only warm-up problem on this boulder.

Stand start in the two right-most holds of the horizontal crack, and move left to smaller holds in the crack. From there, throw up to the crimp bar on the face, match, and use whatever you can find on the face above you to pull up to the lip.

 This climbs the same line as Off My Meds until the last move but finishes with a static move straight up rather than the dyno to the jug out right.
content.protection: At least a couple pads and probably a spotter as there is a tree very close to the landing.
content.location: If approaching from the path, this climb will be on the face around to the left side of the boulder.

content.description: Stand start with hands in the first two holds of the rising, left hand seam /crack. Follow the pods left a few moves, then climb straight up, and get matched on a cool edge hold. Use killer body tension and big kahunas to move right and dyno for the lip.
Stand start as for the problem Off My Meds and Scary Gene Pool and traverse the seam/crack using crimpy pods all the way left to the same finish for the problem Bullet Hard.
content.location: Start with hands in the first holds in the left rising seam/crack on the side of the boulder.

content.description: Stand start on the backside of the boulder about 12 feet right of the problem Pita Chips matched on a crimp bar. Dyno up and make a burly mantle to top out.
Stand start off the big rock and climb straight up. Good warm-up.
content.location: This is about 10 feet right of the problem Glass Rainbow.

content.description: Stand start with your left hand on a sidepull out on the face and your right hand on the arete. Pull on and climb straight up. The sit is a hard project.
content.location: This is about 3-4 feet left of the problem Bullet Hard.

content.description: Sit start the left arete and face using the obvious rock pedestal for feet. Problem starts about 10 feet right of the problem Basket Case

Sit start and climb the obvious, thin, vertical, left-trending finger crack roughly in the middle of the face on the backside of the boulder. This problem starts roughly between The Seed and Bullet Hard.

pathTokens: Goliath Rock-AKA the Bob Parrot Boulder

content.description: Originally named Goliath Rock, this block has more recently been referred to as the Bob Parrot Boulder. Regardless of name this is a great 16 foot block up on a sunny ridge.
